content:
Work History #Research Director, WNJU Telemundo 47 | NBCUniversal Media, LLC #Greater New York City Area | November 2018 - Present
Spearheaded cross-platform primary research studies integrating linear, digital and streaming metrics to understand our local community’s needs/wants which were used to enhance multicultural engagement strategies
Developed comprehensive multi-platform program content and viewership analysis utilizing Nielsen, Comscore, US Census and social/streaming provider data which was used to guide news, marketing, and station leadership teams on strategy
Collaborated with News, Marketing and Multiplatform leads on strategy review and onboarding sessions for Executive Producers, Producers and Creative Services personnel to drive audience reach & retention in our local newscasts and network entertainment, leading to consistently being the number one Spanish-language station in the market across key demographic
Actively monitored and analyzed Nielsen/Comscore methodology and sample modifications to track potential measured viewership impact, ensuring all station department heads remained informed on significant developments
Championed adoption of advanced analytics tools, reducing research turnaround time by 33% while ensuring data integrity and internal compliance standards
Created tutorial videos/documents, provided one-on-one training sessions, and fostered open communication among NBCU Localâ€™s Research leads to exchange best practices/techniques in streamlining workflows and enhancing data-driven insights
Oversaw sales support analytics handled by shared direct report, ensuring data accuracy and timeliness
Research Manager, Telemundo Station Group | NBCUniversal Media, LLC #New York City | July 2016 - November 2018
Claritas department specialist for geotargeting and analysis used in client presentations across the NBCU-Owned Stations Assisted in the design and implementation of World Cup and Olympics standardized report tracking for both corporate and local station sales leadership Managed workflow of standardized program trackers, monthly reporting and sales requests to team of analysts Research Analyst, Telemundo Station Group | NBCUniversal Media, LLC #New York City | April 2014 - July 2016
Boston & Philadelphia market specialist; built, implemented, and managed all regular reporting/trackers featuring program performance, advertiser spending, viewership growth, and automotive registration trends to local sales teams Supported Telemundo NSO, Business Development, and the 16 Owned Television Stations with multi-market qualitative & quantitative data-driven insights Research Analyst, Cox Reps | Cox Media Group #New York City | October 2012 - April 2014
Estimated program ratings and maintained inventory for ABC, CBS, NBC and CW affiliates using Nielsen measurement data to monitor trends and forecast viewership Skills #Programming Languages # Python (pandas, numpy, plotly, matplotlib) SQL (DuckDB, PostgreSQL) Markdown Software # Microsoft PowerBI evidence.dev Tableau Domo Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word) Nielsen NPower Nielsen NLTV ListenFirst Scarborough Prime Lingo MRI Simmons Vivvix|MediaRadar Claritas360 WideOrbit Media Sales Education #State University of New York at Oswego | Oswego, NY | Bachelor of Arts - Broadcasting/Mass Communication
title: CV

content:
If you’re unfamiliar with markdown, it’s easy to learn. The essentials below are everything you need to get started.
While you’re at it, you might as well check out Obsidian
Paragraph #This is a paragraph. It can be as long as you'd like. Add a line break by leaving a blank line. Headers ## H1 Header ## H2 Header ### H3 Header Text Style #**Bold** text is wrapped in double asterisks _Italic_ text is wrapped in single asterisks ~~Strikethrough~~ text is wrapped in double tildes `Inline code` is wrapped in backticks Lists #- This is a unordered list - It uses dashes - To indicate items 1. This is an ordered list 2. It uses numbers to indicate order 3. The numbers you type don't matter, they will be automatically numbered Images #![An online image](https://i.imgur.com/name-of-image.gif) ![An image stored in a folder](/my-image.png) [External link](https://google.com) [Internal link](/another/page) Code Blocks (wrap in ```) #SELECT * FROM amazing_db LIMIT 5 WHERE col = 'Super Simple'; Tables #| Column 1 | Column 2 | Column 3 | | -------- | -------- | -------- | | Row 1 | Row 1 | Row 1 | | Row 2 | Row 2 | Row 2 | Blockquotes #> This is a blockquote > >> It can span multiple lines and also be nested
title: Markdown

content:
Stephen Peek Media Research Director with 12+ years experience in multicultural market analytics and insights.
On this website you will find my CV in addition to a collection of helpful resources, weekend projects, and topics of interest.
Navigate from the top right or take a look at recent posts below. Have a good day!
